fields.title: How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
fields.review: Predictable and sort of boring, but great acting. Classic romcom where both of them are not serious but eventually fall in love.

fields.title: My Best Friend's Wedding
fields.review: A fun, funny romantic comedy that, despite a few weaknesses (Mulroney's somewhat dull Michael), is entertaining from start to finish

fields.title: Sleepless in Seattle
fields.review: Quite likable, old-fashioned romcom, with the two leads well-casted for the occasion, were also so easy-going but somehow seem unexcited.

fields.title: Notting Hill
fields.review: Holds up with creative direction, endearing characters, grounded tender romance, hilarious jokes, and thoughtful writing that strikes deeply. Absolutely charming and delightful.

fields.title: Love, Rosie
fields.review: It's the story of a big and true love, with lots of turns and twists. Nevertheless well-acted and a tearjerker, perfect for an easy night in.

fields.title: You've Got Mail
fields.review: A feel-good movie that offers enough comedy and romance to warm the heart without risking a sentimental overdose, but predictably cliche.

fields.title: Mamma Mia
fields.review: The musical numbers are infectiously entertaining and the performances top-notch but tends to become a bit too saturated when it seems to dilute the plot.

fields.title: When Harry Met Sally
fields.review: The story of the movie was humorous, dramatic, and endearing. It has stood the test of time thanks to its memorable dialogue and laugh-out-loud humour.

fields.title: About Time
fields.review: A rare example of a romcom done in a fresh, memorable, and heartfelt way. This film is well acted, with a surprisingly profound message.

fields.title: 50 First Dates
fields.review: The concept is great and executed perfectly. It's premise is fun and the sappy moments will probably get even the most unemotional person tearing up.
